elexio-api 0.0.1 documentation
modules | index

src package¶

Submodules¶

src.grab_image_from_pdf module¶

This is a function to grab an image from a pdf, based on this: https://nedbatchelder.com/blog/200712/extracting_jpgs_from_pdfs.html

src.grab_image_from_pdf.extract_image(pdf_bytes)¶

Extracts an image from a pdf

Reads through the pdf bytes searching for the start and end flags for an image.

pdf_bytes : bytes
Bytes from a pdf file. Use open(“fild.pdf”, “rb”) and then .read() to pass to this function
jpeg_bytes : bytes
Returns the bytes of the jpeg image
src.grab_image_from_pdf.process_folder(input_folder, output_folder)¶

src.wheatland module¶

@author: Peter Boone email: boonepeterg@gmail.com

Some functions to pull data from the Elexio API.

Documentation for this API can be found at https://wheatlandpca.elexiochms.com/api_documentation (login required)

src.wheatland.get_session_id(username=None, password=None)¶

Posts username and password and returns a session_id string Prompts user for username and password

src.wheatland.download_all(session_id, write=True, file_location='', filename='people_all.xlsx', delim='\t')¶

Requests all of the people and saves it in an excel file

src.wheatland.get_pdf_of_user(session_id, user_id, file_location='')¶
src.wheatland.get_groups(session_id, write=True, file_location='', filename='groups.xlsx', delim='\t')¶

Gets all of the groups and their descriptions, but not who is in them

src.wheatland.get_users_in_group(session_id, group_id, group_name=None, write=True, file_location='', delim='\t')¶

Gets the users in one group

src.wheatland.get_users_in_all_groups(session_id, write=True, file_location='', filename='users_in_all_groups.xlsx', delim='\t')¶

Gets the people every different group. Will take a while to request every group

src.wheatland.get_user(session_id, user_id)¶

Gets all of the info on a single person. The family, group, and note data has to be parsed specially

src.wheatland.get_all_users(session_id, write=True, file_location='', filename='all_users_full.xlsx', delim='\t')¶

Gets the full data on all of the users, one at a time

src.wheatland.get_user_attendance(session_id, uid, week_offset=0, number_of_weeks=50, write=True, file_location='', delim='\t')¶

Gets a single user’s attendance.

src.wheatland.get_all_attendance(session_id, week_off=0, number_of_weeks=50, write=True, file_location='', filename='all_attendance.xlsx', delim='\t')¶

Goes through every user and gets their attendence.

weeks_off = offset back from current week. So 5 would start 5 weeks ago and
work backwards from that
number_of_weeks = the number of events to count. Elexio default is 50. Entering a very
large number will ensure that you get everything
src.wheatland.update_all_users(session_id, input_filepath=None, write=True, write_file_location='', write_filename='updated_all_users_full.xlsx')¶

Compares the local users file to the current database online and updates local

input_filepath = full path to local excel file to run through
